Reason: The configuration option 'snapshot_links_per_second' in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact the system's performance. This configuration determines the rate at which snapshot links are created, which can affect the system's memory consumption and overall execution time, especially during backup and restore operations. A higher value may lead to increased memory usage and longer execution times, while a lower value may result in quicker operations but with potentially higher resource utilization. Therefore, any changes to this configuration can have notable variations in system performance.
